Class SentimentManager

java.lang.Object
core.FeatureManager
sentiment.SentimentManager
public class SentimentManager extends FeatureManager
Manages the sentiment analysis workflow by coordinating news headline scraping and sentiment scoring for a given stock.

This class uses a SentimentAnalyzer to compute sentiment scores from news headlines retrieved by a NewsScraper. It maintains the most recent headlines and sentiment score for use by other components.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SentimentManager()
    Constructs a new SentimentManager, initializing internal analyzer and scraper, and setting initial sentiment data to empty.

  • Constructor Details

    • SentimentManager

      public SentimentManager()
      Constructs a new SentimentManager, initializing internal analyzer and scraper, and setting initial sentiment data to empty.

  • Method Details

    • analyzeSentimentFor

      public double analyzeSentimentFor(StockData data)
      Fetches news headlines for the given stock data's ticker symbol, analyzes the sentiment of those headlines, caches the results, and returns the sentiment score.
      Parameters:
      data - the stock data to analyze sentiment for; must have a valid ticker
      Returns:
      sentiment score in the range [-1.0, +1.0], or 0.0 if data is null or no headlines found

    • getCurrentSentiment

      public double getCurrentSentiment()
      Returns the most recent sentiment score computed by this manager.
      Returns:
      cached sentiment score, or 0.0 if no analysis has been performed

    • getCurrentHeadlines

      public List<String> getCurrentHeadlines()
      Returns the list of news headlines most recently fetched by the scraper.
      Returns:
      list of headlines; never null but may be empty

    • clearSentiment

      public void clearSentiment()
      Clears the cached sentiment score and headline data.

    • getSentiment

      public double getSentiment(StockData data)
      Convenience method to fetch news headlines and directly compute the sentiment score for the given stock data without caching the results.
      Parameters:
      data - the stock data whose ticker will be used to fetch news
      Returns:
      sentiment score in [-1.0, +1.0], or 0.0 if no headlines are found
